event: Earliest evidence of human habitation in Colombia
Tairona and Muisca cultures flourish in northern Andes
Spanish explorers reach Colombian coast
Gonzalo Jiménez de Quesada founds Bogotá
Viceroyalty of New Granada established with Bogotá as capital
Start of Colombian independence movement with formation of local juntas
Simón Bolívar defeats Spanish forces at Battle of Boyacá
Gran Colombia established including Colombia, Venezuela, Ecuador, and Panama
Dissolution of Gran Colombia; Republic of New Granada formed
Name changed to Granadine Confederation
Becomes United States of Colombia under liberal constitution
Conservative constitution creates Republic of Colombia
Thousand Days' War begins between Liberals and Conservatives
Panama secedes from Colombia with U.S. support
Assassination of Jorge Eliécer Gaitán triggers 'La Violencia'
National Front agreement alternates power between parties to end civil strife
Formation of FARC and ELN guerrilla groups
Palace of Justice siege by M-19 ends in tragedy
New democratic constitution adopted
Álvaro Uribe elected president; tough stance on guerrilla groups
Peace agreement signed between Colombian government and FARC
Iván Duque elected president; critic of peace deal
Gustavo Petro elected as Colombia’s first leftist president
